pullRequest.title: Add Lobby Right Click Menus: Show Players in Host & List Player Games
pullRequest.bodyText:
This update enables two right click menus:

Right click on lobby games has a new "Show Players In Game" menu option
Lobby chatters "Player Info" right click menu is enabled for all players and contains a 'games' tab.

Moderators "Player Info" will show all of the previous info plus current game participation, anyone else for now just sees only game participation.
The backend is updated, mainly in GameListing.java, to have an in-memory datastructure of which players are in which games. This data structure is used by both of the new menus. Meanwhile the front-end is updated to send the current list of players when posting a game, and is updated to add and remove players when new players join or leave.
Other Notes
The 'right-click'  menu to show players in a host existed in 1.9, but only for moderators. That was perhaps primarily for technical reasons as a player-to-host remote call could only be securely done for moderators.  The new version here is similar but does not show SystemID or IP. After discussing with @prastle we could not think of a good reason to not allow such a feature for all players. Similarly for the new feature to show the games a current player is in, though that will be a new feature for 2.0 entirely.
Of note, the latter feature to show current games for a player is intended to help moderators. Previously when there were only a dozen bots, it was not too onerous to find players in bots. Now with 40-80 bots, that task is much more difficult (1.9 moderator tooling did not scale well here). In 2.0, not only will a moderator be able to find a player more easily, with luck they won't even really need to since bans will auto-disconnect users from all games. Hence, it's a bit debatable if the 'current-games' feature will wind up being more useful for players or for moderators.

Functional Changes

[] New map or map update
[x] New Feature
[] Feature update or enhancement
[] Feature Removal
[] Code Cleanup or refactor
[] Configuration Change
[] Problem fix:  
[] Other:   
Testing


Screens Shots



Additional Review Notes
The commits are pretty atomic, while there are a good number of them, commit-by-commit might be the easiest way to review.

commit.message: Rename 'PlayerSummaryForModerator' -> 'PlayerSummary'

Update PlayerSummary to have nullable sensitive data

Only moderators will see IP, system-id, bans and aliases; update PlayerSummary
to allow this data to be nullable and update usages.
Allow showPlayerInfo right click menu to all players
Move fetchPlayerInfo client call to its own client (no longer associated with moderator)

Update backend player info fetch to allow players

- Allow some data to be returned when non-moderators request
  player info. Notably do not send aliases or bans information
Remove playerName from PlayerInfo lookup (front-end already has this information)
Update player info to list current games for a given user
Implement GameListing datastructure to track the games a player is in.
Fix player summary no longer has player name (front-end wiring)
PostGame sends connected player information to backend
Update front-end to notify back-end of player joined and player left
Backend implementation for players joining and leaving, and handle nullable player list
Update wire-mock test to skip serialization of nulls
ChattersTest - couple quick fixes
Close PlayerInfo window when escape key is pressed
Implement front-end for 'show players in game' lobby right-click menu
Backend implementation for fetching players in game
Add escape key listener and close buttons to show players and show info dialogs.
Move PlayerInfoController up a package, out of 'moderator' package
Improve javadoc and make GamePostingRequest.playerNames non-nullable
Auto-Formatting

This is something that concerns me a bit. It becomes the client's responsibility to change the online status.
In case the bot loses its internet connection, does the server clear out the entries correctly?
I think it does, but I'd like to be sure I didn't misinterpret something

commit.message: Re-write ServerModel chained optional logic to have an if not null check
Simplify: update GameListing.java to use method references
